abstract: Net neutrality could give Comcast a way out of its Time Warner Cable acquisition. | Warren E. Buffett’s deal for Duracell satisfies a number of his deal-making preferences. | Virgin America to begin trading. | Goldman seeks to lure tech talent.
snippet: Net neutrality could give Comcast a way out of its Time Warner Cable acquisition. | Warren E. Buffett’s deal for Duracell satisfies a number of his deal-making preferences. | Virgin America to begin trading. | Goldman seeks to lure tech talent.
lead_paragraph: NET NEUTRALITY COULD AFFECT COMCAST’S DEAL | Comcast’s $45 billion deal for Time Warner Cable may have seemed like a good idea earlier this year. But now that President Obama has endorsed net neutrality, Comcast might have buyer’s remorse, Steven Davidoff Solomon writes in the Deal Professor column. Given how much detractors have urged the Federal Communications Commission to reject the deal, Comcast may now find, ironically, that the only way out is to have the F.C.C. block the transaction. “This F.C.C. battle all comes down to whether bigger in and of itself is a problem, and President Obama’s statements only add to the troubles for this deal,” Mr. Davidoff Solomon writes.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Net Neutrality’s Effect on Comcast
